intro: Pleurophora aspera, commonly known as the rough pleurophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its rough texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
